alert.note: Alert for Freeborn (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 7:10AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN FREEBORN COUNTY THROUGH 745 AM CDT... At 709 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Twin Lakes, or 8 miles south of Albert Lea, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Albert Lea, Glenville, London, Hayward, Twin Lakes, Myrtle, and Myre Big Island State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 90 between mile markers 161 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.
